intro: Asplenium sphenoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf maidenhair fern, is a species of evergreen fern belonging to the family Aspleniaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, linear fronds that are typically dark green and glossy. The plant produces small, spore-bearing structures called sori, which are clustered on the underside of the fronds. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Asplenium sphenoides is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ease of care.
